Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel, far from city center”
Reviews.Author: fulv1o
Reviews.Content: the marriot courtyard is a good business hotel I spent one night there while attending a conference; however it is not handy if you want to visit the city. rooms are comfortable and at the average level of international hotel. I was a bit disappointed in discovering that the minibar was empty. the hotel offers international breakfast, but I would not reccommend the food at the lounge bar.

Reviews.Title: “It's a Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: Waynomo
Reviews.Content: It's nice. It is really nothing special. It has a nice view of the Vatican. It is an easy 5 minute walk to/from the Gemelli train station which hooks up with the Roma Metro. Just remember that trains run every 15 minutes at 14, 29, 44, and 59. Rooms where clean. A very good breakfast. Internet is a bit expensive if you are not a Marriott Gold or higher member. We stayed here because my brother-in-law wanted to use his Marriott points. If going back, I would probably try and find something downtown. Might be more expensive, but would offer more of a flavor of Rome. There are some small local restaurants and cafes in the area. Nothing special, but all was edible.

Reviews.Title: “Outside let it down!”
Reviews.Author: kaymarrow31
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Courtyard Rome Central park over Easter, while the hotel itself was quite good, and the staff attentive, first immpressions when you arrive are not very good. The flowers on the balconys were all dead at the front of the hotel, which did'nt give the hotel a good appearance when you arrive. The price of eating in the hotel was expensive, but to go out you would have to get a taxi or the shuttle bus as there was no place local, as the hotel is on the outskirts of Rome. According to their infomation booklet the shuttle was free, but we were charged 3 euro each way per person, so if there is 4 of you together this soons adds up. Overall this hotel was ok for a 4 star, but because it was so far out, i don't think i will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: 177sba
Reviews.Content: We are Marriott platinum members and stayed in this hotel while visiting our son who was studying in Rome. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The rooms are large with wonderful amenities. The breakfast (included in room rate) is a highlight. Do not be worried about the location. The hotel accesses Gemelli train station and for 1 euro you can travel right to Sistine Chapel/Vatican. We used public transportation for most of our trip (cab rides can be pricey) The only negatives are that the area around the hotel does not have restaurants/shopping and the Moscati restaurant is overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great location great staff.”
Reviews.Author: yoli1979
Reviews.Content: It was my first time in Italy. I stayed at the Marriott Central Rome for six days. It was a great location away from the crowds. Best thing was the twenty minute shuttle bus ride that took us to the walls of the Vatican. There is a 3€ each way shuttle bus charge. Breakfast buffet was delicious with a good selection of items and great coffee. The staff was very helpful with any questions or directions. Our room was very clean with a view of St. Perter's. When needed to be taken to the airport just request Taxi one day in advace. The taxi to the airport was 55.00 €. Our stay was the best and will return back to the Marrott Central Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, but outside Central Rome”
Reviews.Author: Rmknow
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 days. The service was good. The hotel was clean and the room was huge. It is quite a bit outside central Rome. We were shocked at first, but enjoyed getting out of the hustle and bustle at night. Breakfast is great, the restaurant was not so good. However, there is a fantastice restaurant around the corner called Gaia.bio. Overall, it was a good experience and I would stay there again. Not to far from the airport. Take public transportation to central Rome and the hotel shuttle to the Vatican. Avoid cabs to this location!!

Reviews.Title: “Great View - Easy Access to City Center”
Reviews.Author: Sheila E
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very lovely, close to transportation to get you around the city, resturants near are very reasonable and the food, atmosphere was great! Front desk staff were very helpful! Resturant and lounge food is pricey, service is not what is expected in N. America, have to remember to just sit back and relax, enjoy the fact you are in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel near Gemelli station”
Reviews.Author: CharlieFrance
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Courtyard Marriott Rome Central Park at end of February 2012. I paid 95 euros per night for 3 nights excluding breakfast. I booked on Marriott's own website to get such a good rate. My room was large with comfortable King-sized bed, large flat-screen TV and nice bathroom. I slept very well in this hotel. There was lots of choice at breakfast, I used the small gym upstairs. I also ate at the restaurant one evening which served good Italian food. I thought it was a little bit expensive. The only drawback with this hotel is that you have to walk 5 minutes to Gemelli station and then get on a train if you want to go sightseeing in Rome. This was not a problem for me. Alternatively there is a hotel bus which will drive you right to the Vatican for a 3 Euro fee. I would highly recommend this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Distance from city centre but good”
Reviews.Author: ivan025
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights, A distance from attactions but train terminal is close. Market is close for cheap water and a selection of other needs. The price is much lower than downtown so practical. Service was great at reception . Bar and restraunt were good. Breakfast was so varied my willpower was tested daily.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very good location!”
Reviews.Author: jivkas
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my husband for 3 nights. Exactly what I would expect from Marriott. Friendly staff, clean, comfortable beds, great food and atmosphere in the restaurants. Located near major transit station which makes it really easy to get to all the attractions!! They also have a shuttle to take you to downtown. Saying all that, price was ok. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel but not the greatest location!”
Reviews.Author: Paloki80
Reviews.Content: My wife were happy with the hotel. It was clean and friendly. The price was right. We loved the balcony and the view of the city. The only drawback was the location. The hotel did provide hourly transportation to St. Peters near the subway and buses. The concierge service was very helpful during our visit.

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms.”
Reviews.Author: rdw59565
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Did not have any problems with the front-desk staff as indicated by other reviewers. Staff was helpful and courteous. Hotel is about a 15 Euro cab ride from most of the tourist attractions in the city. Restaurant for breakfast was pricey but very good. As indicated in other reviews there is a grocery store across the street from the train station, down a driveway to the left of the bank. We went to the "locals" tavern that the front desk recommends one night, the food was good and reasonably priced. They charge for wireless internet unless you are a Marriott gold or platinum member. We used the shuttle several times, at 3 Euros per person each way it was a good deal. The front desk has a free map with all of the attractions listed that is far more useful than the maps in the guide books that we purchased. We enjoyed good weather between Christmas and New Year's so we walked almost everywhere. If you are very comfortable with public transportation the subway/train system is fair. Do not expect the Washington DC Metro or the London Underground. The stations are filthy, the signage is not the best and the subway stops near tourist destinations have their share of pickpockets. The rooms at this hotel are huge by European standards. We tried the snacks at the bar, not great but seriously...it's bar food. Would stay again despite the distance from downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms, nice view, terrible customer service and incontinent location”
Reviews.Author: MStivaletti
Reviews.Content: They were 4 hours late checking us in! We waited in the lobby for 2 hours! People were rude and unwilling to help, in spite of the fact my husband speaks Italian. Not close to tourist spots or the airport, not far from the subway which is easy to use.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Was Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Sadie G
Reviews.Content: My husband and i along with our moms stayed at the hotel for 4 nights and it was excellent. A couple blocks to the subway station so you had the option of spending 1 Euro for the ride per person into Rome, or take the hotel shuttle for 3 Euro per person. We did both.... Rooms were great and the staff was very helpful. We would definitely recommend the hotel and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for short stay”
Reviews.Author: jh_traveler004
Reviews.Content: This is right behind the train station but if you go at night, it looks a bit shady. The hotel was average, check-in was fast. I'm a platinum Marriott member but they don't give you free breakfast or anything free other than wireless internet free and that's only for 1 device! If you want to use their computers in the lobby, you get 15 to 30 minutes free to use, depending on which front desk person you get. I'm not sure what the reasoning is for that. Our room was large for Rome and it had a patio and overlooked Vatican City, beautiful view at night time. The bathroom was kinda disgusting and old, similar to what the other reviews posted, this Courtyard needs renovation. Our shower curtain had blood stains on it and I was completely grossed out and was going to call them to change it the next morning except housekeeping had entered our room even though the 'Do no disturb' sign was on! Nice it was changed, but not so nice when I asked them to not come in while we were gone. The hotel sends you to a little family restaurant a block away in a small strip mall but that wasn't open the night we came. We actually found a nice pizzeria that sells everything and at reasonable prices! If you turn right at the light up the hill from the hotel rather than left, go about 1 block you will see a small pizzeria. People are really nice and food was great! As others have noted, this hotel is far from the city but train is easily accessible. I would recommend this hotel if you are using points and for short stays.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a good restaurant, however far from the city”
Reviews.Author: Helsinki-Mic
Reviews.Content: The hotel is far from the city of Rome. Yes, you see the cathedral, but by car/taxi/bus it is almost 30 minutes away. Otherwise, the hotel was very nice with a big balcony. The staff was friendly and the breakfast great. Since we had our baby with us, we ate almost every night at the hotel restaurant. The food was delicious! And the staff very friendly. I would however, not recommend room service, nor the bar(?)/bistro close to the hotel lobby. The food there was terrible, the Marriott burger and pizza were uneatable. But, if you don't mind the transportation to the city center, this is a very good price-quality stay.

Reviews.Title: “A known standard”
Reviews.Author: metromuppet
Reviews.Content: Located within minutes from a local train station, Gemili, it takes around 15 minutes to reach the main sights of Rome. I chose this hotel because its a known chain that I have used before and wanted a set standard. Rooms are large, clean and modern with most rooms going onto a balcony with seats. The hotel does offer a shuttle service to the central attractions, but we travelled by the local train, changing onto the metro. All of which was hassle free and added to the holiday, mixing with the locals. The hotel is set just off a main road, but tucked away enough to be quiet. Check-in was easy and straightforward, as was check-out. Do note, as with all hotels in Rome, you have to pay a city tax which is per person per night. If you want a reputable chain I can recommend this hotel, despite the distance, its well worth the travelling. After all, it is no different to staying the other side of London and heading over by Underground. The usual in room amenities are found, shower gel miniatures, in room safe and large flat screen TV. If you do use the local train to reach the hotel, when you exit the station, you will go up a set of stairs, on reaching the top, you will see another set of stairs and a path to the side, go up the stairs and turn left which takes you out the station. The hotel is on the first left as you exit. Most rail planners can assist in changes from your intended start station such as RailEurope.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in Rome you will like it”
Reviews.Author: GogiKastav
Reviews.Content: Recently I spent three nights in Rome at this Courtyard, and I highly recommend it. It is not close to the Rome down town action, but they have a shuttle bus that drops you off right by the Vatican. Also the underground is a two-block walk. For me it was important distance, a 10 minute walk, to the most important hospital in Rome, Gemmeli clinic. Hotel is surrounded by nice park and situated in quiet neighborhood. The most interesting thing is refrigerator in the room- it is empty so you can put your stuff inside and if you want some usual "mini-bar things" you can find it at wending machines in the hotel lobby or ask them to fill it up. In some other hotels (Sheraton Munich) they will extra charge you if you want empty refrigerator. Notice to the hotel webmaster-there are no instructions how to get hotel from airport by public transportation so I used instructions from Gemmeli clinic web site.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the eternal city”
Reviews.Author: GOVtravelerNewYork
Reviews.Content: After arriving from Paris, we found this hotel to be simply amazing. Our balcony room had a breathtaking view of St. Peter's dome. Some of the reviews criticize its location being outside the city. We personally enjoyed being outside the city since we were able to connect to the city directly through public transporttaion which was a short 5-minute walk away. The staff at the hotel were very helpful with tips on getting around. Buy the Roma Pass! Again, some reviews criticized but we found it to be great. We walked straight to the front of the line at the Colosseum instead of standing in line for more than 2-hours. It didn't help at the Forum Romano but the two hours saved in the hot sun at Colosseum was well worth its weight in gold.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Debby C
Reviews.Content: We recently spent five nights in Rome at this Courtyard, and I highly recommend it. It is not close to the central Rome action, but they have a bus that drops you off right by the Vatican, and a two-block walk to the Metro. It is also a 10 minute walk to a train station, which is convenient for going to the Forum, etc. The hotel food was excellent, it was immaculate, comfortable and the staff worked very hard to help us and make our stay a good one. We had a room that faced the city, and our terrace gave us a wonderful view of the St Peter's Basilica Dome. It was magic at night...

Reviews.Title: “The staff did everything right”
Reviews.Author: marian s
Reviews.Content: The five days beginning 9/30/11 were on Marriott points so we weren't expecting such a nice hotel and such a pleasant experience. The front desk staff were very efficient and helpful; food was surprisingly good and the room was both large and immaculate. Best surprise was the large balcony with a jaw-dropping view of St. Peter's and two nights of fireworks . The location was fine; we used the shuttle each day; for two of the days there was a public transportation strike so the shuttle was particularlyl helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Property and Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Gaylen C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at several Courtyard Marriott's throughout our 2 weeks in Europe and this one was the best. The accommodations were very nice and the staff was extremely helpful. The outdoor terrace was a wonderful place for dinner and the property was only a few blocks to the train station, which made it easy to get into Rome. The dining room had a wonderful breakfast buffet. We would highly recommend this property to anyone traveling on business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Meher S
Reviews.Content: I had a great time staying in this hotel, the staff was very courteous and helpful. The quality level of this courtyard was much better than a regular Marriott courtyard. Will definitely recommend this to people with families.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay , Convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: elenxhi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 days.The location of the hotel is not bad as other people mentioned.It's almost 3 miles far away from the city center.But the transportation in Europe is really well organised and hotel also provides shuttle bus for 2 Euro per person.The front desk did arrange a pickup from the airport for €55.00. My taxi ride from the hotel to the main railway station (Termini) cost €24.00. The hotel has excellent customer service and whenever we needed extra towels the housekeeping came in a matter of few min. What we really liked is the a full service supermarket located across via Sacchetti called Carrefour Mercato. It’s located down a long driveway next to the bank. We stocked up on drinks and snacks there. Prices are not inflated because this is a typical neighborhood supermarket located miles away from tourists. Each room has a small fridge, so keeping soft drinks and water chilled was easy. Each floor has, an ice machine. The restaurant for breakfast buffet has many choices, we ate there a couple of times typical to an american breakfast. Very close to the hotel are restaurants and cafe's where you can get your early morning pastry and coffee.But, cornetti (pastry with early apricot marmalade, my favorite) and cappucino for 2 was less than 4 euro's. The pastry and coffee in Italy is amazing! We had an excellent time and would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great start for Rome 1st timers”
Reviews.Author: Tim11502
Reviews.Content: A bit removed from downtown but the 20 min shuttle to the Vatican and public transportation cures that. Dont rent a car for Rome as it may be hazardous to your well being. Do it for touring the rest of Italy. Has all the touches of a US hotel but with a European Flair. Good meals but bit pricey. Gelato is high priced and ordinary. Better at most gelaterias. I second 55nrdtofly, shawman2008 and jludacka comments.

Reviews.Title: “Great Safe US Stay”
Reviews.Author: shawman2008
Reviews.Content: It's a typical Marriott Courtyard which based on our other experiences in Rome can lend some comfort to American's staying for the first time or looking for a consistently clean and more US feeling hotel. Food at restaurant was good, gym a little small but decent and rooms were clean. You are a little ways out but everything is reachable via subway. It's not in the center of Rome is really it's main downfall.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: jludacka
Reviews.Content: This hotel is literally right around the corner from the train station. If you have a map of the train station, Rome is easy to navigate. Hotel was very nice. Room was good size for Europe. Staff are very helpful and polite. The shuttle is a nice perk to the Vatican. We had a wonderful view of St. Peters.

Reviews.Title: “Inconvenient to get and run down”
Reviews.Author: AussieBlazers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our family for a short visit. We booked very late and there were not many options so we took a chance and booked at the Courtyard Rome Central Park. Generally I feel that Marriott maintain their hotels at an acceptable standard. Unfortunately this hotel is the exception to "generally"! The rooms are run down and smell musty, and almost everything in the hotel is due for refurbishment. The staff are mixed with some being helpful and some being borderline rude. I wouldn't recommend this hotel unless you are looking for a 3 star hotel and are prepared for 30 minutes of travel to get into central Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel at all costs”
Reviews.Author: Harmi
Reviews.Content: Worst Marriott I have ever stayed at. The lobby looks clean, once you go up to your room the hallways are disgusting . The front desk staff were very rude. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone or stay here again .

Reviews.Title: “Poor service; prices mysteriously increase; smelly room; eggs run out at b/fast”
Reviews.Author: KurienM
Reviews.Content: We encountered a number of problems during our 3 night stay here: 1. The room was smelly 2. We were at breakfast at 9 am, and when we pointed out to the server that the boiled eggs had run out, she went to the kitchen and reported back to us that the hotel had run out of eggs. 3. Housekeeping left stuff half finished in the room - eg., glasses unwashed, napkin not replaced etc. 4. On booking a car for a 3 am airport drop, we were told it would be € 60 at 6 pm the previous evening. But when we went at 3 am to check out, the amount had mysteriously increased to € 80. 5. In the lounge bar, a request for a drink of Scotch resulted in some completely different obscure liqueur being served. Though it was replaced, this was a fist time experience for us. 6. Overall the staff seemed quite disinterested and at times rude. 7. I have stayed at many of your Marriott properties, but this was the first experience of it's kind.

Reviews.Title: “A bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: DavidMM2010
Reviews.Content: Standard Courtyard experience, nothing special. We stayed there on points. The hotel is a bit out of the way but we did not have any problem taking the train into the city every day. On a few nights we stayed until midnight or 1am and had to take the taxis. They cost $25 Euros to get back to the hotel, although the hotel will tell you it will cost around 11 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, but not close to main places”
Reviews.Author: I_love_my_trips
Reviews.Content: We stayed on this hotel for 3 nights in November 2010 and we believe it's very good. The rooms are clean and spacious. The only reason I rate this hotel with 4 stars is because is far from the main touristic places in Rome. However, there is a shuttle (for a fee) that goes from the hotel to the center Rome every day, every 30 minutes or so. It will leave you near the Vatican city entrance. Also you can take the closest train station (Gemelli) and move around the city within the train-metro-bus network. One important tip: the metro multi-ticket is valid also for bus and train inside Rome, so you don't need to spend more money on bus and train tickets. I would recommend this hotel if you don't mind spending around 30 minutes going and coming back from the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Naitingale
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Rome on our honeymoon. He is a Marriott Platinum Rewards member so we decided to use his points for our stay at this particular hotel. First, this hotel is supposed to be a category 6 but don't believe the hype. On walking into the hallways and the rooms, you'd think you just walked into a motel or some lower category hotel. We were supposedly on the executive floor but it sure didn't feel like it. The room's layout was ok, the bathroom was tiny (which was expected) and the sink did not look too clean around the edges. Our first night, my husband started suffering from terrible allergies - congestion, difficulty in breathing- but these would clear the minute we stepped out of the room. After about two days, we had to go to the local Farmaccia to buy some antihistamines. The bathroom smelled badly of mildew. The hotel was fully booked so we could not change our room. Also, the bed was really hard and uncomfortable. We did not notice this the first two nights because we were exhausted from our flight in and from sightseeing. However, on subsequent nights, we'd wake up feeling really achy and we're young people! I normally prefer to sleep on firm mattresses because of my back, but this was almost like sleeping on a rock! By the way, do not waste your euros taking their shuttle to the Vatican. It is 3 euros each way and if there are at least 2 people in your party, you're looking at 12 euros per day minimum. There's a train station about a 5 min walk away called Gemelli, and you can buy the Roma pass, or buy the normal timed tickets at 1 euro each, hop on the regional train (trenitalia) going toward Ostiense and connect to the metro with the same ticket. Very easy to do. Ask the Hotel's front desk for maps, directions, and schedules, and tickets. Very easy to do. It is even just as easy to take in the train and metro from the airport rather than taking a taxi that costs 50 Euros. That's about 70 dollars! There are not many eateries in this area. There's a really nice Gelaterie, about two or three pizzerias, and one restaurant that serves nice food. It is hard to stay in the city till late at night because the metro stops around 9 pm due to some construction work, and the regional trains stop at 10:30pm. You can take a bus but that is too much of a hassle and the one time we did that, we almost got lost and it took us an hour to get back. The other option is to take a taxi which should cost about 15 euros depending on how far away you are. We found it much easier on our pockets to take the train into town and eat breakfast and lunch there because it was much cheaper than trying to eat around here. All in all, do yourself a favor and stay someplace much closer to the city if you do not want to be hemmed in for the night at about 9 pm and if you suffer from allergies or hate hard and uncomfortable beds, or want to save your money for things like sightseeing and good food. At least, even if you end up in a hotel that's not so great but is right in the center, you have the advantage of the great location.

Reviews.Title: “not too far from the city center - public transportation cheap and easy to use”
Reviews.Author: Lilly0508
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one week while we visited Italy. Many of the reviews mentioned that the hotel was far from the city center but we made it work for us! Just behind the hotel is the train station that connects you to the metro and another option is the shuttle service that is provided by the hotel that takes you straight to the Vatican. From the hotel we visited the Colosseum, Vatican City, did a day trip to Florence, Pisa and even Venice. The hotel staff made all this possible because they were so helpful and knowledgeable. If you stay in the city center you still have to move around from one end to another to visit the popular tourist sites. We enjoyed every night in our room it was so comfy and relaxing to come too after a long day of walking and site seeing!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if you are comfortable with public transportation!”
Reviews.Author: AnuTexas
Reviews.Content: After reading several of the reviews online, I had reservations about booking this hotel but after recently staying there, I was pleasantly surprised. To begin, the hotel is located ~3 miles from the main Rome Termini metro station. It will take two trains, two euros and about 30 minutes to get from Termini Station to the Gemelli station adjacent to this hotel. Riding the metro in Rome is a very safe and relatively fast process, so first time travelers should not have reservations about utilizing the public transportation. In terms of the hotel, I was pleased with the room size, amenities and the front desk customer service. Upon arrival, they congratulated my wife and I on our anniversary and also sent a wonderful complimentary bottle of red wine and pastries. For hotel frequenters, internet service was free and relatively fast. The surrounding areas seemed safe enough for my wife and I to walk around and there are some decent enough restaurants and pizzerias within a ten minute walk. If you are a loyal Marriott customer and/or don’t have concerns with public transportation, this is a great choice for you. Otherwise, it might be better to spend more money and stay in a hotel within Rome city limits as all of the main tourist attractions are closer to that area.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with friendly/helpful staffing!”
Reviews.Author: Ken P
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Rome after completing a transatlantic cruise. Choose the Courtyard because of pricing, quality and convenience. While Courtyard is generally known as a business hotel, I observed the desk staff with an easy transition to "tourist" advisor with an enthusiasm rarely observed in tourist destinations. It aski had the convenience of a subway stop just a short walk away. Don't drive in Rome!!!! Take public transportation!

Reviews.Title: “Great if using Marriott Points”
Reviews.Author: MindyPDX
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights using points. The hotel is pretty typical Marriott, clean and comfortable. The front desk staff was very helpful. We were able to easily figure out the train system to get into the city center. It probably took between 30-40 minutes between the train and metro. A couple nights we took a taxi home and it costs between 15-20 euros. There are some stores and little restaurants in the area and we always got breakfast on the way out for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: yanda
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with fantastic and helpful staff. We had a great room overlooking central park, shuttle bus from the hotel takes around 10-15mins and drops off next to Vatican City. Great food and service in the restraunt will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “reasonable hotel but staff quite grim”
Reviews.Author: Peter1Northampton
Reviews.Content: decent marriott, clean well furnished, breakfast buffet not bad. Staff customer service particularly at reception is dreadful accepting the culture and language barrier, customer service is pretty universal but not here! Rooms clean and nicley furnished. Get a high floor as there's a reasonably busy side road. Beware booking preferences count for little. To get into rome you catch a train near to the hotel (5 minute easy walk) it takes 15 minutes and you change to the metro about 3 stops down which is fairly easy. Best to get a Roma Pass. You can get to the hotel from Fumicino Airport. Take the train from the airport to Trastevere and change to the FR3 line through to Gemelli. Costs £8 euro's each and is the cheapest way. Takes about 45-50 minutes in total.

Reviews.Title: “best bed and biggest room in our Italian vacation”
Reviews.Author: PLUMBO
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first 2 nights of our 11 day trip. Little did we suspect that it would be the best bed and biggest room compared to the other 4 hotels we stayed in as we traveled around. The desk people were super-nice and helpful. My only complaint was service and food quality in the lobby lounge. We didn't find it difficult at all taking the train here from the airport or the train and then metro into central Rome. It was nice to be a bit secluded from the hubbub of Rome and the area felt very safe.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, clean rooms, horrible location”
Reviews.Author: Jdelcampillo
Reviews.Content: Great value for the hotel. Honestly, no major complaints,just the fact that the hotel was out of the way made an inconvenience. Taxi drivers seem to hate coming to this side of town, they either overcharge you or give you a nasty attitude. The restaurant was great, again, great staff with good food.

Reviews.Title: “Dont Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: VB2theworld
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the executive floor and the room was still very small. The hotel is very far from anything. The cab from the train station to the hotel cost 40 Euros. Every time the AC turns on is smells like mildew, so we just keep the door open. The shower frequently fluctuates between hot and cold which is just plain annoying. If you would like a late checkout it will cost you an extra 50% of the daily room rate. Internet access is not free and will cost you 22 Euros a day or 10 euros an hour. Hotel offers a shuttle to the Vatican which takes about 15 min and cost 2.50 Euros per person each way. In the case of me and my wife anytime we wanted to leave the hotel it cost us 10 euros every time that's just ridiculous. I have stayed at 6 different hotels while on my 15 day trip through Italy and this was by far the worst hotel of all. Even the staff was rude and unaccommodating.

Reviews.Title: “very quiet”
Reviews.Author: FedeF
Reviews.Content: I have been here a couple of times. It is a joy to sleep in this hotel where rooms are very quiet. Maybe the location is a bit far from tourist attractions but there is a shuttle service provided by the hotel to the city center and a train station is just two minutes away, then consider 30 minutes to downtown. Good for business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Value”
Reviews.Author: WanderKindner
Reviews.Content: I read reviews earlier and was a lil scared of the commut. It was not bad at all. The shuttle service is now from 8 -12 PM and 4:00 - 9:00 PM and that works out well. Gemelli is closeby and the hotel staff was great. They did give away our original booking inspite of a communication that we will be a day late but the management more than made up for it. Lovely view of St. Peter's dome. Dont forget to swing by the local convenience store - awesome cappucino for 90c. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Courteous, professional as well as personal personnell.”
Reviews.Author: mjeannef
Reviews.Content: Very accomodating, helpful and very gracious. My husbnad's and my brand new 150.00 shoes were stolen from our luggage at the airport, the staff intereceded for us as best as they could to act as an intermediary for us and the airport. It was to no avail, but not for lack of effort on their part. They have a shuttle for 5 euros, round trip,that takes you to the Vatican and from that part you can branch out to many sights. Taxis are very expensive to my notion so the shuttle is quite a bargain. The rooms are quiet and clean, we had a great view from our balcony of St. Peter's. We had a wonderful trip aside from the theft. I would advise that NOTHING of value be put in your luggage , you have to be aware of more then the pick pockets there. Wear a money belt, don't let your purses hang from your arm, and stay off of bus 64, known over there as the wallet eater bus.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, but away from most tourist attractions”
Reviews.Author: jfmelle
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Courtyard Rome Central Park for four nights in January 2001 with my wife as part of a vacation through Italy. I booked the hotel due to the rate. Hotel room was excellent. Bead was extremely comfortable. Rooms was very large. Very clean. Breakfast was very good. Hotel provides transportation to the Vatican City area. Hotel is modern and woth it.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL LOCATION. Do not stay here unless you love BIG ROOMS”
Reviews.Author: JACKPO
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights and I must tell every tourist who is thinking about staying here (because it is a Marriot): RUN AWAY. DON'T STAY HERE. 1) The location couldn't be any worse. You might as well stay in Sicily. This hotel is EXTREMELY INCONVENIENT if you are a tourist looking to explore the great city of Rome. Unless you plan on getting back to the hotel before 10 p.m. every night, then the location is not that bad. (for more on details, see below). Otherwise ... NIGHTMARE. 2) The view was OUTSTANDING. We stayed in a beautiful large American style room with a million dollar view of St. Peter's in the Vatican but it cost us approx. $300/night. So if you plan on staying in the room alot, this hotel was wonderful. It's rare to find such large rooms in Italy. But after an hour, the view becomes less impressive 3) The WIFI is very expensive. It adds up over a few days. 4) The breakfast was unsatisfactory. __________________________________ Let me share our horror stories regarding transportation to/from this hotel. We arrived in the late afternoon and decided to head into the city of Rome for a late dinner. Then we walked around and enjoyed Rome at night. Around midnight, we decided to head back to the hotel. We tried to enter the subway but it was CLOSED. We eventually learned that the subway closes at midnight. Being from New York with a 24/7 subway, this was a shock. We tried to find a cab to take us back. No such luck. We finally persuaded a regular citizen (not a taxi driver) to take us to our hotel at one o'clock in the morning (after begging a dozen people with cars). It cost 50 euros. The next night, we made sure we entered the subway by 11 p.m. The subway took us to the last stop where we then had to transfer to another train to take us to our hotel. GUESS WHAT? THAT TRAIN STOPPED RUNNING AT 10 p.m. There were no people or cars in sight. And the streets were very dark and desolate. We had a map and after ONE HOUR of brisk walking, we were able to make our way back to the hotel via dark creepy hilly country roads adjacent to a park. Finally on our last night, we left Rome at 8 p.m. and were able to catch the hotel shuttle back to the hotel. So what's my point???? Unless you leave Rome at 8 p.m. every night, DON'T STAY HERE. For the same amount of money, you can book a 4 star hotel in the HEART OF ROME. Otherwise it was a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Doable jaunt into the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: MrsHermesMA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with the goal of sightseeing Rome and it worked out wonderfully. We took the train out to the hotel from the train terminal. It was about 45 minutes but I was a little nervous towards the end. We found out its very safe but if you traveling with your grandparents or your schedule allows, plan to take the hotel shuttle that picks up right outside the Vatican. We didn't know about this until after we got to the hotel. The hotel shuttle drives into Rome and drops off/picks up passengers right outside of the Vatican. Its 2 euros per person each way and we used it every day (they have a schedule at the front desk); the charge can be billed to your room. The shuttle leaves exactly (if not 1 or 2 minutes early) at the scheduled time from the city so make sure you get gelato at Old Bridge across the street and eat it while you are waiting! Our room was nice and big, and the bathroom was impressive for a Courtyard. There was a mini-fridge that we used every day. The housekeeping staff is the best I have ever seen- they organized all of my makeup and things on the counter in a way that made me feel like I was at a department store. The restaurant downstairs is AMAZING. We ordered dinner twice (w bottles of wine) to take back to our room and we received excellent service. The food was fresh and flavorful. The staff was great. A few complaints about this property- they didn't have our reservation. Even after I showed them our printed confirmation they had to create an entirely new reservation and told me not to worry, "we have rooms." You better have rooms! I just flew 3500 miles! A businesswoman the next day had the same problem. Apparently they have problems all the time with the US system inputing data into the Italian system. I HIGHLY recommend calling/faxing/emailing the hotel after you make your reservation. There was not a pool. Their snacks/drinks/beverages in the Marketplace are expensive and they have a poor selection. Perhaps they were just out of basics at the time. The air conditioner in our room did not work. We could not control the thermostat and were too warm every night. We could have left our balcony door open for breeze but I am a whip and didn't want to. Overall, we enjoyed staying here and will stay here again the next time that we come (after double-checking to make sure they have our reservation!).

Reviews.Title: “Stay downtown”
Reviews.Author: drgchicago
Reviews.Content: While they would like to make you think that this hotel's location is near things because you can see St. Peter's, the reality is that you can see St. Peter's from most of Rome. The location sits outside the central part of Rome so getting to everything requires taking a shuttle bus (only convenient for the Vatican), a train/subway/bus combo for the ancient central district of Rome, or long cab rides (that can be expensive when returning if you happen to be east of the river - 40 euros or over $50). The restaurant tries to be something it is not and is very expensive for the quality of the food. We ate there once and that was once too often (only choice for us Christmas dinner). Front desk service was not all well trained and made numerous errors with us including a missed wake up call that almost resulted in our missing a scheduled tour to Pompeii. At no time did anyone offer to help with bags (I believe they do not have any bell men). Internet service is available but expensive - 19 euros per day for a laptop or 10 euros a day for a smartphone. Completely ridiculous given that we also stayed in Florence at the Luchessi which offered free service for as many user accounts as you wanted. If you do stay there, make sure you are on a higher floor or on the back side not facing St. Peter's so that the parade of delivery trucks and garbage trucks starting at 6 am don't wake you up (although this is what saved us from missing our tour).

Reviews.Title: “Worked well for our family”
Reviews.Author: Candice21
Reviews.Content: The location although not ideal didnt phase us at all. The hotel offers a shuttle to Vatican City and from there we could catch the Red Citysightseeing buses from just inside and so in the end the price, good sized rooms made our trip very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ibnebatuta29
Reviews.Content: Its a very well maintained property. Though its 20-30 mins away from central Rome it is well connected by train. The Gemelli train station is a 5 min walk from the hotel. Tickets are available at the front desk or the gift shop. The rooms were spacious, beds large and very comfortable. We would definitely stay here again,

Reviews.Title: “out of the way but enjoyed the peace!!”
Reviews.Author: Stefdiego
Reviews.Content: We knew it was not central Rome but did not mind we had points but I would recommend because we loved the peace in the evening.After a full day in Rome a glass of wine on our deck with our fabulous view was great. We found Nicola at the front desk a great help with reservations and just general help.He always referred to us by name when he would see us .We loved the the local restaurants (one close by but forgot name).Our room was very comfortable clean and modern. We enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accomodations - transportation required to Rome City Center”
Reviews.Author: audittflyer
Reviews.Content: Great Marriott property - knowledgeable, courteous, and caring staff. This is a great place with the only drawback that transportation is required to Rome attractions. Hotel provides shuttle but frequency and locations not always convenient. One pet-peeve is the daily charge for internet use - UGH!

Reviews.Title: “too far from Rome”
Reviews.Author: cooldoc1971
Reviews.Content: It is a bit too far from Rome. When I arrive at the airport, I tried to make my way to the hotel using the train service ... too much of a hassle with the luggage ...I finally arrived after about an hour and a half ... you can arrange an airport transfer for Euro 55 per way. It's better to book in advance with the hotel. A friend of mine had to pay 100 Euros for a cab he picked upm from the airport !! From the hotel to Rome you can use the train with one change to the Metro line ... i tried in once, but the Roman trains are a bit unreliable in terms of timing, so I decided after that to stick to the hotel shuttle bus for our trips to Rome.. it cost 4 euors for a round trip, The location of the conference venue is about 10 mins walk so the hotel was conveniently located as far as the conference is concerned. The rooms are definitely clean and spacious The breakfast spread is good. I had to pay for internet .. it is 22 euros for a day, which is really steep! I ended up taking a 7 day plan costing me 88 euros. I had to be connected because of my work. As for the staff, most of them are helpful and polite, though 1 or 2 of them may appear a bit arrogant. All in all, if you are not on a budget and willing to do a bit of daily travelling into Rome, the pluses may outweigh the minuses.

Reviews.Title: “No swimming pool”
Reviews.Author: Jctauro
Reviews.Content: A tidy and comfortable hotel. No much amenities, we were there during hot summer days, a pool would have made for a great stay! Alas, there was none. Their breakfast offerings were scrumptious, everyone got something they liked.

Reviews.Title: “Not Marriott Caliber”
Reviews.Author: VAtraveler1953
Reviews.Content: The room was ok - a tad small - but the people who work there need an extreme makeover. They are very rude and not at all helpful. The hotel is in the middle of nowhere, so maybe the staff could recommend a place, other than their hotel, to eat? They want 2 euros to print out a boarding pass! The guy at the desk told me it would take him 15 minutes to print it out - YIKES.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but way too far out”
Reviews.Author: stephbunny4
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is very nice and clean except any extras such as internet or a drink of pop from the shop are very expensive. As this hotel is very far out (it is way too far to walk into the centre of Rome) a shuttle bus is provided which is helpful but only runs at certain hours. We decided to go out one evening and the shuttle bus had stopped running so the night time receptionist offered to call us a taxi. Whilst we were waiting for it to arrive we decided to go out front and take pictures by the palm tree's and as we were walking out the door he shouted over to us, in a rude tone, not to leave because the taxi was on the way. We explained we were only going to take pictures out front but he obviously did not believe us because he sent the bell boy out to watch us which was very patronising. When the taxi did arrive the metre was already at 12 euro's. We ran back inside to the reception and were told that because it arrived in under eight minutes that's the starting price. I would have rather waited 9 minutes and not had to pay such a ridiculous starting price. We felt the receptionist ought to have informed us of this sneaky charge but I assume they are on some sort of commission deal with the taxi company. Also they offer a shuttle back to the airport for 55 euro's, but we flagged down our own outside the hotel who did it for 40 euro's. Do not stay here it is just too far out form the centre, the last shuttle bus is at 9:30pm so if you wanted to have a relaxing meal and a drink out you then have to pay 25-30 euro's in a taxi to get back to the hotel. Also it is obviously not a very well known hotel, when we arrived at Rome train station none of the taxi drivers had heard of it or seemed to know where it was, it was 20 minutes before we found a taxi which was aware of it. We were three 20year old girls and we just felt we were patronised and not taken seriously in particular by the man on reception in the evening who had a smug attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the big issue”
Reviews.Author: rob3066
Reviews.Content: Arrived by taxi from Ostience Railway Station in south Rome (27 euros) late morning. Not easy taking your suitcases up into Reception, there are a number of steps and only a makeshift ramp system for the suitcases. Checkin was a bit chaotic, there were three members of staff and to checkin, each one had a part to play. Would have so much easier if one person dealt with us. Our room on the 6th floor had a balcony and distant views over Rome. The room was really well equipped, clean and a good size. We were right outside the lifts, but that didn't cause any noise problems. There is as mentioned a shuttle bus service into Rome, drops off/picks up at one location, adjacent to the Vatican City walls. It makes the journey in and out every hour from 0800 through to 2200 hrs except for the period between 12 noon and 1600hrs when there is no shuttle. The journey took 20-30 mins depending on the traffic and it had plenty of room. We did have dinner at the Hotel, this was of good quality but very expensive. We also had breakfast, but the variety and the freshness was not great. The location, probably about 3 miles or so out of the centre is an issue, if you cope with the shuttle or the local trains (station about 5mins away) then it presents good value for money. Internet is available via computers in the lobby at 35c per min. I think there is also Wi-fi. The Hotel has an airport transfer car service available at 50 euros and took 30-40 mins at 300 miles per hour, well it seemed like it!

Reviews.Title: “a bit remote, but a very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: David L
Reviews.Content: We stayed in August for 5 nights - using points. From a value perspective, it was 'great'! I also received a room upgrade so we were very lucky to be treated to a larger room. The location is a bit remote and this can prove tricky when using public transportation especially at night - the trains stop early. We got stuck one night and had to cab it back from Valle Aurelia - for 15 euro's. The shuttle from the hotel takes you right to the vatican for 2 euro's and we used this every day. It will also bring you back, but that service stops early in the evening - so, planning is a must. There is another review here about a local market close to the hotel where you can pick up bread, meats, wine etc. We found it and here is a bit more detail on where to go. It is the "Supermercato" on the other side of the 'very' busy road behind the hotel. From the hotel, go right on their street, take the next right and make your way (carefully) across they busy main road. It is a little bit to the right from here - you cannot miss it. Just walk down the paved laneway, it is at the bottom of this road. Bring cutlery and a corkscrew from home. You'll be able to enjoy late dinners or make and pack lunches for your siteseeing in Rome! We bought wine back to Canada that we purchased from here. The restaurant for breakfast buffet has many choices, we ate there only once. Very close to the hotel are restaurants and cafe's where you can get your early morning pastry and coffee. However, they have odd hours and sometimes were closed - not sure why. But, cornetti (pastry with early apricot marmalade, my favorite) and cappucino for 2 was less than 4 euro's. I never saw anyone walking down the street with a coffee in their hand like we do in North America. The pastry and coffee in Italy is amazing! The only not so great thing was booking a tour of the Vatican/Sistine chapel through the hotel. The booking was not good and the tour also disappointing. You cannot tour these two locations in 3 hours. Next time I would pay the money to "skip the line" and once inside, turn over the wireless headset to the tour guide and go on my own. All in all, it was a very nice, comfortable hotel. I would next time book in the centre of the city. I will mark this as a recommendation - with the caveat of, if you want to save some money and don't mind being remote.

Reviews.Title: “A nice Marriott hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: davsuze
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little out of Rome but it is a nice hotel with a shuttle to downtown or you can get a taxi. The rooms were clean and very comfortable. We got to sleep in late because it was quiet and you were not disturbed by the houskeeping staff. The Front Desk staff were very friendly and helpful. There was a bar and restaraunt downstairs that was convenient and had good food. The breakfast buffet for $12 Euros was good and I thought reasonable and had a good variety of food. We had a very nice dinner there also. I would recomment this hotel and if I were in Rome again I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel but much too far from the city center”
Reviews.Author: SuzieBobby
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks really great, rooms are clean and comfortable, equipped with tea and coffee maker. The staff is very helpful and, what is important they all speak good English. The location is however not rewarding, too far from the main Rome's attractions. The public transportation is limited to one train line only.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable with a very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MarcJordan
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week at the Marriott Rome Central Park. Prior to reserving a room there I scoured all of the TripAdvisor reviews trying to read between the lines to come up with a good idea of what to expect out of this hotel since its basic flaw seems to be that it’s a bit out of the way. The hotel itself is very nice. If you are looking for a property with large, American sized rooms, incredibly comfy beds and linens, then this place is for you. The marble bathroom was very nice as were the balconies (half of the rooms face St. Peters) and the air conditioning would please even Chilly Willy (a very important factor in Rome). The staff could not have possibly been nicer and more accommodating. One gentleman at the front desk that I was super impressed with was Nicola. His English was as good as any American’s, he’s very well informed and was able to answer all of my questions (and girls, he’s good looking too). Nicola represents this hotel in the best light. We opted to eat in the hotel each morning to save time. The overall selection was good but the scrambled eggs were a bit funky. The fruit was excellent and the selection of meat was quite good. Coffee is served out of a machine which will also dispense espresso, cappuccino and lattes. Cereals were plentiful as well. The hotel is located in a middle class residential area. As has been written here before, it’s slim pickens when it comes to restaurant’s in the area. There is a very good pizza place and a few doors down from there a full service restaurant with a somewhat limited menu called Taverna Sacchetti. Turn left on via Sacchetti and you will easily find them. Pizza was priced at about €4.50 for a large individual pie. The tavern had basic dishes (mostly pasta) for about €8.00, but that’s about it folks for eating in the area. We did get a recommendation from the front desk for a restaurant that turned out to be excellent, but it is located one stop down on the train. When exiting the Balduina station, make a right and just a few feet away is Capperi, which is also located in residential area. The prices were very reasonable (about €12.00 per entrée) and the meal was very good. The menu selection was large by the way. There is a full service supermarket located across via Sacchetti called Carrefour Mercato. It’s very well hidden and located down a long driveway next to the bank. We stocked up on drinks and cheese there. Prices are not inflated because this is a typical neighborhood supermarket located miles away from tourists. Each room has a small fridge, so keeping soft drinks and water chilled was easy. Something else each floor has, which is a rarity in Europe, is an ice machine. Most of you reading this review are concerned about the hotel location. I’ll give it to you straight folks, it’s not terribly convenient. It’s located a very short walk from the commuter rail line called the FM3, at the Gemelli station. You can connect to the subway three stops down but the transfer at Valle Aurelia is a slight pain because the commuter line runs on an elevated section and the subway is below ground. Since most escalators in Rome don’t work, some people will be huffing and puffing, although each station does have an elevator (not that I would trust them – this is Rome you know). The basic problem with the commuter line is the wait between trains. At best it’s 14 minutes (during rush hour), at worst – 35 minutes. Twice we had missed the train by inches and waited the full 35 minutes. I didn’t think having to take the train would bother me but it did because it meant that I couldn’t simply go back to the hotel during midday and rest. My wife and I landed up leaving in the morning and eating dinner in Rome and heading back once we felt the day was over. The rail line seemed safe but the graffiti is something you have to see to believe (aesthetic pride is not one of Rome’s strong suit). Each ride is a very reasonable €1.00 and you can purchase multi-day passes which allows you unlimited rides on the commuter lines, subways, buses and streetcars. This was the biggest bargain in all of Rome. Although the trains run on the honor system, I urge you to buy a ticket because I did get spot checked and those without a validated ticket will get a nice fat fine on the spot. The hotel has a shuttle service to a subway stop a few blocks from St. Peters (Ottaviano), but they charge €2.00 per person and I didn’t think it was worth it. Others have written here that it’s a free service so I’m assuming they recently instituted the fee. The front desk can arrange a pickup from the airport for €55.00. My taxi ride from the hotel to the main railway station (Termini) cost €24.00 and took about 18 minutes at 7:00am. I brought my laptop and was able to find a “stray” WIFI signal and connected for nothing, otherwise the hotel does have wireless service at €17.00 per 24 hour period. I stayed at this Marriott property because I used Rewards points and didn’t want to blow most of my account staying downtown at the Grand Flora. The amount of points I saved staying at the Central Park will allow me to stay a week at a beach resort, so I have no qualms about that. If you are adventurous and don’t mind the inconvenience, then stay here. The staff will certainly make you feel at home. Feel free to send me a message if you want specific questions answered.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Megan1136
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting a whole lot from this hotel, but was very pleasantly surprised. The rooms are very spacious and have the "American" amenities we’re used to. We asked the staff a million questions about how to get around Rome and everyone was very helpful and knowledgeable. It's not in a very central location, but they have a free shuttle that goes into the city center every half an hour. We used this daily and it was very nice. There is also a supermarket and pharmacy within walking distance, and a train that takes you to the metro. The on site restaurant and room service were also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Good 4 star hotel, excellent night”
Reviews.Author: apvac
Reviews.Content: Although the tripadvisor name does not say, this is a Marriott Courtyard (the "limited frills" brand by Marriott). I had a very good experience There is an external (pay) parking in front of the hotel and covered parking under the hotel. The latter is not sign posted, but you can easily find it by entering the gate beside the Hotel building. It is not cheap (25€) but in line with expensive parking in Rome and, in my opinion, it must be selective since it would not have space for everyone. It has separate management from the hotel, so you have to pay in advance and in cash. It is rather convenient since it is secure, you lock your car and keep your keys, you have direct access to the hotel elevator. Friendly checkin, good, recently renovated room. Large flat TV, balcony, just an empty refrigerator (courtyards have a little market in the lobby where you can buy what you like). Working and individually controllable air conditioning. The bathroom was not very large but well organized with everything useful, including bidet. The bath tub is short (it is on the short side of the bathroom), but I used it for the shower only. I had a good room service dinner. Buffet breakfast was sufficiently varied, although nothing more than average. What is more important, the bed was very comfortable, the room was extremely quiet and I had an extraordinarily good night. The location (near Gemelli Hospital) is good enough for moving by car, near the centre but not in the more congested and restricted zones.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service with a Smile”
Reviews.Author: CathyNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: The entire staff, from front desk to chambermaid, provides efficient, caring,service with a smile. The rooms are spacious, clean, quiet, and seem to have been recently renovated. Marble bathrooms are well appointed with tub/shower combination, great water pressure, endless supply of hot water. We visited in January, and appreciated the in room climate control, with no skimping on heat. The food and service in the restaurant at dinner was excellent, at about New York prices. Only downside at the restaurant was that they refuse to serve tap water at the table, and the fish soup was not fresh. Ate there 4 nights and everything else was fresh and delicious. Breakfast was buffet, with no cooked to order items, and the quality of some of the offerings were just mediocre, but there was a sufficient variety of decent items to fill up on, and really great cappucino. Yes, the location of the hotel is 25-30 minutes distance from the city center via their van or public transportation during rush hour, but you cannot find the quality this hotel offers at twice the price in central Rome. And the quietness and fresher air was lovely. The new Marriott management has upgraded every aspect of the hotel. Internet is way overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Remote location but worth it.”
Reviews.Author: jklallo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week. Location is remote but transportation was no problem at all. Took a shuttle from the airport with 2 other couples. Cost was 50 euros. We were the last stop so we were able to see most of the city. Traffic was crazy. Not the best idea to rent a car. The hotel provides transportation to the Ottavanio station which is about 7 blocks north of St. Peters Square. There is also a train just north of the hotel that runs every 20 minutes that connects you to the red line. We would usually take the hotel transportation in the morning and the public transportation in the evenings back. The greatest benefit to this hotel is the fact that it is out of the city. It is very quiet in the evenings and there are restaurants, markets and shops within walking distance. For my wifes birthday we had dinner at the hotel. It was 95 euro for both of us including wine, so prices were comparable to the US. The food was very good. Also the first night we just ordered room service since we were tired from the trip. I had a bottle of wine from the hotel for 16 euro. Now here is the best part, the next day I walked north to the next road then made a left. About 100 yards down on the left is a market. I picked up some assorted cheeses, meats and bread along with a bottle of wine of course for about 16 euro. The wine at the market ranged from 2.70 to 3.00 euro per bottle! Worth while to walk around and check out the neighborhood. We brought some silverware and a corkscrew with us. The staff at the hotel was very friendly and helpful. The room was on the sixth floor. It was the camera room. Great pictures off the balcony overlooking the city.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: tjcooper
Reviews.Content: We found the staff helpful. The room are modern and clean. We had a balcony, king bed. The train is about 5 minute walk from hotel. Goes south to major lines thru Rome for 1 Euro. Also have a van that goes every hour to vatican. It only holds 16 but we had no trouble when you arrive 10 minutes early. Breakfast was good and we highly recommend it. Loved sitting out on balcony at night -only view of wooded area but peaceful after the hussle and bussle of Rome. The terrace at front of hotel was great to eat at and have a drink at night. 4 1/2 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Rooms, Excellent Staff, Near Vatican”
Reviews.Author: sandbagger27
Reviews.Content: Had excellent communication with Management prior to arrival...General Manager, Georges Midleje, of hotel was outstanding host...Assisted with reservations at hotel, attractions and could not have been more attentive and helpful....Shuttle each hour to the Vatican extremely handy and "on time" From there, no problem to catch a bus to Colleseum and any other attraction. Rooms have been remodeled and are very nice...Top floors recieve excellent view of St. Peter's Basilica. A few local restaurants near by but the hotel has an excellent facility for breakfast and dinner.Would have no problem staying with this Marriott once again....and would look forward to seeing Mr. Medleje once again as he and his staff gave 110% during our five day stay......

Reviews.Title: “Inconvenient Location, Don't Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: lucaska
Reviews.Content: The only reason I stayed here is because I got a free night with my Marriott Rewards points and I'm thankful it was only 1 night. This location is awful. I guess if you're only in town to see the Vatican, then it is fine, but it's still a 10 minute shuttle bus ride there and it is not close to any of the major sites in Rome. The hotel was nice, but it's an American hotel. Everyone in it was American, so if you like that sort of thing this is for you. I, on the other hand, hated it and I'm glad we stayed our remaining 4 nights in Rome at Navona Garden Suites, located in the heart of old Rome just steps away from Piazza Navona. That place was far better and far cheaper! Check them out at www.navonagardensuites.com.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Remote Location”
Reviews.Author: sandytomGraniteBay
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the process of becoming a Marriott. The service and the restaurant food was very good. The view from our room was of the dome of St. Peters and was spectacular. The only bad thing about this hotel is its location out of town. The hotel has a free shuttle. However the shuttle takes you to a metro stop in an outlying area of Rome. It is not convienent to go back and forth to the hotel. We like to stay in a more central location. With all the Rome choices we would not stay here again because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money or points here”
Reviews.Author: weyst1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is terrible. Starting with staff that don't have much local knowledge and are somewhat stand-offish and the rooms are no frill (which is fine) but smells old and funny... In our second day there, the hotel has no water and no power during middle of day. The staff were not trained to handle the situation at all. The hotel offers Internet at 22 euros a day or you can use te business center Internet at .50 euro per minute. The hotel is quite a bit away from central Rome though the hotel has a shuttle running hourly to the train station by Vatican city. I am a platinum elite member with Marriott and I have to say that I regret the decision of wasting my points with this terrible hotel. It's by far the worst Marriott I have ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Shady characters and lack of security”
Reviews.Author: Twinkids12
Reviews.Content: We had a nightmare experience at this hotel. My husband stayed in one room with our teenage son and I stayed in the next room with our 15 yr old daughter. Around midnight, a man started calling my room (thinking that he was talking to my daughter) and said that he had seen her in the elevator and wanted her to come out for "tea or coffee". I assured him that he had the wrong room. He did not give up. 15 mins. later he called insisting that he knew who he was talking to and that he did have the correct room. Once again, I forcefully told him that he had the wrong room and hung up on him. My daughter and I went to sleep and at 1:30 in the a.m., the man started calling again, insisting that "I" come out and meet him. I was really mad and hung up on him. This time I called the front desk and told him that someone was harrassing my 15 yr old daughter who was petrified by this time. They said that they couldn't tell from what room the calls were being made and when I asked about security cameras, they told me that they had none. They said they would send security up. This never happened. Another call came in and I just hung up and immediately called the front desk for help again. "Oh so sorry. I'll send up security". Never came. My daughter and I were petrified and we called my husband to change rooms with us. The next morning my granddaughter told us that a man tried to coax her into a room on our floor - he was in the room immediately across from our room! It was a sleepless night. The lack of security was appalling. Never would go back there.

Reviews.Title: “definately not value for money”
Reviews.Author: pjaj
Reviews.Content: on our recent trip to rome - we stayed at central hotel rome - although the location of the hotel is very good- the rooms are very small- it just ends where it starts - there is not enough room to walk around. for the price they are charging we definately expected a better room

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice newly acquired Marriott Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2boystravelling
Reviews.Content: Hotel itself was adequate for what we needed: Pros: Upgraded room to Suite that over looked St Peters Staff were very friendly and accomodating In a quite residential area Free shuttle to Vatician area (though it stops around 7:00 PM) Cons: Not in Central Rome and train stops running at 10:30 PM Very few restuarants to chose from in the area Have to pay for gym access Internet cost is very expensive Breakfast buffet very expensive Overall if you don't mind public transportation that is a very good Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, value for money and location not a problem!”
Reviews.Author: ruthiepoole
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from this hotel and had a great time. The hotel is beuatiful, lovely terrace with a great view, which is ideal for drinks in the evening. Bar prices are a little high. Moscatti restaurant is wonderful, very attentive staff and great food. No bread or service charge unlike 99% of hotels in the city centre. Try and request a room with front facing view. The hotel does provide a minibus transfer on the hour between 8am and 9pm, except 1 hour at lunch time. Only 16 seats so you do need to get there early. We always managed to get a seat there and back every day. You are dropped 5 minute walk from Vatican. I would have preferred a city centre hotel but would have paid probably 4 times as much for this. If you can good a good rate then i would definately book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money, unless you like bad service”
Reviews.Author: uniquevariety01
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at hotels all around the world and at this hotel, the service was far from immaculate. Good: shuttle service to the city (when available), rooms are clean and modernized Bad:THE BED IS BY FAR THE HARDEST, most firm, BED EVER ,3 English TV channels, expensive internet, horrible customer service (waited 2 hours for a room service menu, waited a hour in the lobby while disrespectful staff talked on the phone, took forever to find the hotel (don't even try taking the train), the hotel is poorly labeled, there is absolutely nothing within walking distance to the hotel, the space in the shuttle is limited (it was often full). The room service food is pitiful. The staff always seems like they have something better to do, than help you out.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, transport to the city can be a pain”
Reviews.Author: JimSoup
Reviews.Content: I stayed in late June with my wife and two kids (9 and 11 years), using Marriott points, for 6 nights. We reserved two rooms, and the hotel accommodated our request for the rooms to be connected (door between the rooms). The room was nice, with wood floors, and was very clean. We did not have a balcony, but I believe this was due to my request for the connecting rooms. We had problems with the air conditioning in both rooms, but they were quickly fixed by the staff. We ate only one meal at the restaurant (and even then just from the bar menu). Food was good, and we did get an occasional bottle of wine for the room. The wine was priced similarly to (or even a little less than) a restaurant in the city. There is a grocery store across the street from Gemelli station, although I was never able to catch it open. The big (and really only) issue I had with the hotel is the location. Yes, what other people have written is true. It's not hard to get there on public transport, and the shuttle bus does run hourly (on the hour into the city, and on the half hour back to the hotel). What we found, though, was that the bus filled to capacity on almost every one of our trips (it's a 16 person bus). If you don't get there early, you get turned away. Also, the regional transport lines don't run that frequently on the weekends, and you can end up waiting for those if you go that way. In the end, it felt like we planned around the bus schedule. It would have been nice to stay closer in to the city to allow easy access to the hotel. One other minor thing - a couple of times I needed to speak to someone at the front desk before leaving for the day. The wait in the lobby was 10-15 minutes easily, as they only had two people working most days, and there are always lots of foreign travelers (like myself) trying to check in early. More staff would have helped!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel - Undecided About Location”
Reviews.Author: NomadDiva
Reviews.Content: First of all, I want to address the location. It doesn't matter if it's the most amazing hotel in all of Italy if it's too far from the sights. We only used public transportation (i.e. regional trains, subways), and I felt it was totally reasonable. Rome's subway system is very effecient with frequent trains and signs indicating how long your wait will be. We never had to wait more than five minutes. You get off the A line at Valle Aurelia, take a short walk over to the train station, and hop on the northbound train. You go three stops and get off at Gemelli, and the hotel is less than a five minute walk away. The problem is that the regional train doesn't run as often as it should. And the train stations in Rome do not do a very good job of indicating which train comes when. We even almost got on a train that was going the right direction, but for some reason it was not stopping at the Gemelli station. If you caught the right trains at the right times, it could be a 15 minute trip to the heart of Rome. But if you don't, it could take a good hour. I felt it was a reasonable gamble considering the cheap tickets (1E one journey, but 4E for an all day pass - my recommendation). My husband found it tiring and often ridiculous. The hotel itself is very nice. As most travelers from the USA will, we arrived long before check in. The staff was very friendly and very helpful. We were able to get into a room at 10am. It was large, with beautiful wood floors, a balcony (which I was not expecting), a comfortable bed, and a very nice bathroom. It was recently aquired by Marriott and they've been doing improvements. I understand it is scheduled to be called a Courtyard, but I felt it was much nicer than your average Courtyard hotel room. I did not see Marriott on anything in the entire hotel, so they must not be in a hurry to make the transition. Overall, I felt it was a good value. We had a promotional rate of 110E per night. It was very nice, clean, and comfortable. It is further from the sights, but anything closer is outrageously priced. It's not hard to get to central Rome, it just could take some time depending on the trains. If you're flexible and don't mind waiting at train stations, then this is a great budget option for Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel quickly getting up to Marriott standards”
Reviews.Author: Arnie512
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent four nights (June18-21) and had a very comfortable stay. Initially, we were intimidated with the transportation options but once we tried the free shuttle and/or the local commuter train it was very convenient to get into the center of Rome. We found the front desk, especially Kristofersen, very helpful in laying out the options for finding the main tourist sites and how to walk around the city. The room was very modern and recently renovated and based on what we heard the hotel should be up to Marriott standards within a couple of months (mostly has to do with finishing exterior appearance). We enjoyed the main restaurant as they were serving outside and the weather was very cooperative. The grill was a major plus and the meals were served very professionally. The local restaurant that was recommended by the front desk was very enjoyable and reasonably priced. The only downside was that the free shuttle filled up quickly and there is only one van available. A couple of times we had to take a short walk to the commuter train which arrives about every 15-20 minutes. The cost is one euro and it is very convenient to transfer to the metro system (at no extra charge).

Reviews.Title: “Comforts of an American Hotel, yet comletely European!!”
Reviews.Author: NormalNancy
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect modern American hotel, yet w/ European flair. We visited Rome in April and wanted the comforts of home (modern hotel, bathroom, etc). This hotel was extremely clean, comfortable and a quiet oasis in a large city. It is NOT in the heart of Rome. The shuttle leaves every 30 minutes and take approx. 15 mins to arrive at a location very close to the vatican & metro station. We NEVER had a problem catching the shuttle, though I did read in the summer it can be full. We had a suite room w/ a seperate bedroom and we're extremely satisfied. The restaurant on-site was not great, but there are local restaurants a few blocks away. It is in a quiet residential area, but still with an urban feel. I highly recommend this hotel if you want a more modern hotel, but are willing to travel (slightly) to be in the heart of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, reasonably priced, but not centrally located”
Reviews.Author: rar6621
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for four days to tour Rome on my own. Very good hotel in most respects. Only major negative is location. At least 45 minutes to city center by public transportation. As routed by the ATAC website, I took Bus 994 to the metro station (Baldo degli Ubaldi) and then took the metro into the center. To reach the hotel from the Rome airport, I found it easiest to take the FM1 train from FCO (NOT the Leonardo Express) to Trastevere, then transfer to the FM3 train to Gemelli station, then a short walk to the hotel. Buses, metro and light rail often were very crowded with limited or no service after about 10 p.m. Hotel also operates a limited shuttle, If you are comfortable using public transport, this hotel can be a good value with some flexibility. Otherwise, you might prefer to stay in a more central location.

Reviews.Title: “If you are planning a visit to Rome, stay away!”
Reviews.Author: jdawwgg
