Reviews.Content: This place is so far away from the city, it was a nightmare. Luckily it was only for one night. We called the hotel from the states and they said it was a 27 minute ride to the airport. That's why we stayed there on our last night in the country. Turns out It was 90 minutes via the transit, so we ended up taking a shuttle for 55 euros. The directions that they gave to us were poor as well. After you get off the subway, there is supposed to be a bus to the corner near the hotel, but we couldn't find it, and had to take a taxi. Once we checked in, the toilet wouldn't flush. When I called to tell them, the phone didn't work. This place was just bought by Mariott, and the manager said that they were working out the "kinks," but, based on location alone, this isn't a good spot unless you've got some business in this suburb.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - not so far away from city center”
Reviews.Author: rbwii
Reviews.Content: Initially we were concerned with the hotel's location as it is not in the city center. We were pleasantly with how easy it was to get from the airport (FCO) to the hotel and back and into the city center (free shuttle and via taxi). I believe the hotel is undergoing renovations and we stayed in what was clearly a remodeled room - and it was beautiful, comfortable and had a balcony overlooking the city. The staff was just okay and reasonably helpful. The neighborhood was cool. We ate at an awesome family-owned restaurant about two blocks away (sorry but I have forgotten the same, but it is on the main street in the opposite direction from the train station). From the airport, take the L1 to the L3 - so easy and inexpensive. You can use the L3 to get to and from the city - or the free shuttle (the drivers are not nice or helpful), or a taxi (about E20). DO NOT pay for the breakfast as it was very disappointing. Also, the restaurant is good - a little pricey but good. There are much better options in the city - check Rome reviews of restaurants in the city as they provide excellent recommendations. Also, if you are looking for a good tour, check out Eden Walks and do the sunset tour and the Vadican tour with Grant. Amazing and fun.

Reviews.Title: “for business travel and more”
Reviews.Author: civilian
Reviews.Content: Really nice three stars hotel. European style: rich but sober. Fully furnished room, including a water boiler and some tea and coffe bags. Everithyng looked clean. A special mention to the breakfast: superior! Everithing, from the american taste to the local italian specialities, was delicious. It worth waking up earlier in the morning. The hotel is near to the 'Policlinico Gemelli' and 'Universita' Cattolica', that you can reach by foot in 5/10 minutes. The area is not one of the best I saw, but neither seems too ill-famed. A couple of 'trattoria' in the neighbours: we eated in the 'trattoria sacconi' and we were satisfied (beware it is really popular and not so clean, but the know how to cook). The light-train station 'gemelli' is near the corner and connects you to the urban metropolitan subway.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: PumpkinDenver_CO
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 6 nights and had a wonderful time. We are Platnium with Marriott and choose the hotel due to the price. We used the train to get to the hotel from the airport without any issue and utilized the free shuttle to and from the city while we were there. Only once was the shuttle full on a Sunday morning. Most of the time it was us and one other couple. If you elect to take the train back from the city, be sure to get on the local and not the express. We made the mistake once and ended up an hour and half outside of Rome! Our rate included breakfast. It provided a good American/European selection, but neither of us would touch the scrambled eggs. We also had dinner in the restaurant one night. It was Ok, but nothing great. We really enjoyed dinner at a place a block and half from the hotel called, Gaia. It is an organic restaurant and pizzaria. We also went to the local "typical Italian restaurant" and also had good service. The hotel is undergoing renovation and I would say is a good value for what you are paying.

HotelInfo.Name: Courtyard Rome Central Park
HotelInfo.Address: Via Giuseppe Moscati 7, 00168 Rome, Italy
